description.narrative: To enable conflict-affected people and communities to meet their basic needs and live in safe and dignified conditions, enabling the building back of personal and local resilience.
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Conflict-affected households are provided with in-kind food assistance to address gaps in essential needs
Communities are made safer through reduced exposure to Explosive Hazards, increased awareness of the risks posed by explosive ordnances, and the adoption of safe behaviors;

Output indicator 1.1.1 # of community members reached with EORE messaging (disaggregated by age / gender / displacement status) (Syria) [target: 5,400]
Output indicator 1.1.2 # of local partners trained and empowered as EORE actors [target: 1](Syria)

target.value:
Output indicator 1.1.1 5400 (1,500 Boys, 1,500 Girls, 1,200 Men, 1,200 Women)
Output indicator 1.2.1 1 local partner

Output indicator 1.1.1 5400 (1,500 Boys, 1,500 Girls, 1,200 Men, 1,200 Women)

title.narrative: Conflict-affected households are provided with rapid, market-based support to address gaps in essential needs;

Output indicator 1.2.1 # of people receiving market-based humanitarian support (cash distributions) [target: 16,700] (Syria & Lebanon)
Output indicator 1.2.2 % of people reporting cash distributed enabled them to better meet their basic needs [target: 90%] (Syria & Lebanon)

target.value:
Output indicator 1.2.1 10,500 3,000 (500 men, 500 women, 1,000 girls, 1,000 boys) (Syria) 7,500 (1,875 men, 1,875 women, 1,875 girls, 1,875 boys) (Lebanon)
Output indicator 1.2.2 90% of people reporting cash distributed enabled them to better meet their basic needs

Output indicator 1.2.1 6,200 1,200 (300 men, 300 women, 600 girls, 600 boys) (Syria) 5,000 (1,250 men, 1,250 women, 1,250 girls, 1,250 boys) (Lebanon)
Output indicator 1.2.2 90% of people reporting cash distributed enabled them to better meet their basic needs

title.narrative: Children and adolescents have improved access to inclusive, safe, educational facilities, through the rehabilitation of local schools;

Output indicator 2.1.1 % of targeted learning spaces with gender- and disability-sensitive WASH facilities [target: 100%] (Syria)
Output Indicator 2.1.2 # of students benefiting from improved educational facilities [target: 1,600 students –800 girls 800 boys] (Syria)
Output Indicator 2.1.3 # of schools rehabilitated [target: 8] (Syria)

Output Indicator 2.1.2 800
Output Indicator 2.1.3 4

title.narrative: Homes damaged by conflict are rehabilitated, providing safe and inclusive shelter solutions to vulnerable families;

Output indicator 2.2.1 # of shelters rehabilitated (including both informal and traditional housing structures) [target: 800] (Syria)
Output indicator 2.2.2 % of affected people indicating that shelter and settlement assistance reflects their needs and priorities and contributes to a more durable solution [target: 80%] (Syria)
Output indicator 2.2.3 % of households that report having received appropriate technical assistance and guidance [target: 80%] (Syria)

target.value:
Output indicator 2.2.1 400
Output indicator 2.2.2 0%
Output indicator 2.2.3 0%

Output indicator 2.2.1 400
Output indicator 2.2.2 80%
Output indicator 2.2.3 80%

title.narrative: Households affected by conflict are able to meet their basic needs and practice safe behaviors, saving lives.

Outcome indicator 1.1 % Reduction in average CSI score for the target population
Outcome indicator 1.2 % in reduction in reported accidents resulting in injury or death, related to EHs at the community level over 12 and 18 months compared to known 2021 accidents (Syria)

target.value: Accidents reported to the NES MAC are reduced by at least 20% in 12 months and 30% over 18 months

title.narrative: Essential community infrastructure will be rehabilitated, improving the safety and functionality of public and private spaces;

Outcome indicator 2.1 % increase in children, teachers, and other staff who report feeling safe in the rehabilitated school [target: 90% increase] (Syria)
Outcome indicator 2.2 % of HHs reporting feeling more safe / secure in their homes as a result of adapted shelter support [target: 90%] (Syria)

target.value:
Outcome indicator 2.1 90% increase
Outcome indicator 2.2 90% increase
